intro: Symbasiandra repens, commonly known as the creeping symbasiandra, is a low-growing, trailing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive elliptical shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are fragrant. Symbasiandra repens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
